summary: Email correspondence from July 2019 discussing legal filings in the Florida CVRA case involving Jeffrey Epstein. The email references arguments about whether the Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) extends to New York, filings by Jane Doe 1 and 2, and a motion by Epstein's lawyer Marty Weinberg for a sur-reply. The sender is updating recipients on recent developments and opposing further briefing extensions.

persons.name: Marty Weinberg
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who filed a motion for a sur-reply in the Florida CVRA case, arguing for an opportunity to discuss the scope of the Non-Prosecution Agreement.

persons.name: Judge Marra
persons.context: The judge presiding over the Florida CVRA case who is poised to rule rapidly on the motion for a sur-reply and asked for a quick response.

connections.description: Weinberg is an attorney filing motions before Judge Marra in the Florida CVRA case, and Judge Marra is considering his motion for a sur-reply.

events.title: Filing by Jane Doe 1 and 2 in Florida CVRA case
events.description: Jane Doe 1 and 2 filed a recent filing in the Florida CVRA case, arguing that the Non-Prosecution Agreement only covers Florida crimes and victims, not New York.

events.title: Motion for sur-reply by Marty Weinberg
events.description: Epstein's lawyer Marty Weinberg filed a motion for a sur-reply to discuss the scope of the Non-Prosecution Agreement in the Florida CVRA case.

events.title: Planned opposition to Weinberg's motion
events.description: The sender plans to file an opposition on Monday to Weinberg's motion for extending briefing further in the Florida CVRA case.

keyFacts: The email discusses legal arguments that the Florida Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with Epstein only covers Florida crimes and victims, not extending to New York or other jurisdictions.
Epstein's lawyer Marty Weinberg filed a motion for a sur-reply to argue about the scope of the NPA, which the sender opposes to prevent further briefing extensions.
The sender references that their clients (Jane Doe 1 and 2) were told in 2013 that the NPA did not extend to New York, reinforcing their current legal position.
Judge Marra is actively managing the case, requesting quick responses and poised to rule rapidly on procedural motions.
